meanings.definition: In a touchy or easily offended manner.
meanings.sent1: She reacted touchily when he accidentally bumped into her.
meanings.sent2: She always takes things touchily, getting upset over small comments.
meanings.sent3: He touchily defended his favorite team when his friend teased him about their recent loss.
meanings.sent4: The cat hissed touchily at anyone who tried to pet it.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase wobbled touchily on the edge of the table.

meanings.sent1: Her touchily expressed emotions made it hard to have a calm conversation with her.
meanings.sent2: The touchily written letter conveyed her frustration with the situation.
meanings.sent3: The touchily painted walls clashed with the rest of the room's decor.
meanings.sent4: The touchily tuned guitar produced a beautiful, but delicate sound.
meanings.sent5: The touchily balanced equation required careful handling to avoid errors.

meanings.sent1: He touchily responded to any criticism of his work.
meanings.sent2: She touchily defended her decision to leave the party early.
meanings.sent3: The child touchily refused to share his toys with his siblings.
meanings.sent4: The politician touchily avoided questions about the recent scandal.
meanings.sent5: The dog barked touchily at the mailman, protecting its territory.
